titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Town of Bushwick town meeting minutes 1986.039
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-08-09 20:01:36 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Town of Bushwick town meeting minutes
did.abstract: The Town of Bushwick town meeting minutes are housed in a single bound volume and feature minutes of the meetings of the Town of Bushwick, N.Y. (currently the Bushwick neighborhood of Brooklyn) from its incorporation in 1841 until 1851.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single volume.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The first Bushwick town meeting was held April 7, 1841 at Martin R. Meeker's home. Among the first officials elected in the town were: Nicholas Wyckoff, Supervisor; Abraham Vandervoort, Town Clerk; and Jacob Suydam, Charles DeBevoise, and Lambert Wyckoff, Assessors.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Town of Bushwick town meeting minutes, 1841-1851, 1986.039; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Town of Bushwick town meeting minutes are housed in a single bound volume and feature minutes of the meetings of the Town of Bushwick, N.Y. (currently the Bushwick neighborhood of Brooklyn) from its incorporation in 1841 until 1851.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.

controlaccess.geogname: Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.) -- Politics and government -- 19th century
